CheckActions.ApplyEngineV2Long: Set the EngineVersion property of a page to EngineV2 to get access to all reporting tool features.
CheckActions.ChangeReportToInterpretationMode: Change the report to the interpretation mode
CheckActions.SetGrowToHeightToFalse: Set the GrowToHeight property to false
CheckActions.SetGrowToHeightToTrue: Set the GrowToHeight property to true
CheckActions.StiAllowHtmlTagsInTextActionLong: Set the value of the AllowHtmlTags property of the component to true, for correct showing the HTML tags.
CheckActions.StiAllowOnDoublePassActionLong: Set the NumberOfPass property to DoublePass for correct calculation of variables.
CheckActions.StiApplyGeneralTextFormatLong: Set the 'General' format for the '{0}' component.
CheckActions.StiCanBreakComponentInContainerActionLon: Set the value of the CanBreak property of the component to true.
CheckActions.StiCanGrowComponentInContainerActionLong: Set the value of the CanGrow property of the container to true.
CheckActions.StiCanGrowGrowToHeightComponentInContain: The GrowToHeight property will be set to true for all components in container. This operation does not guarantee the 100% correct fix!
CheckActions.StiCanGrowWordWrapTextAndWysiwygActionLo: Set the value of the TextQuality property of the component to WYSIWYG.
CheckActions.StiColumnsWidthGreaterContainerWidthActi: Automatically change the column width depending on the width of the components.
CheckActions.StiComponentStyleIsNotFoundOnComponentAc: The value of the ComponentStyle property will be cleared.
CheckActions.StiDeleteComponentActionLong: Delete the component from the report.
CheckActions.StiDeleteConnectionActionLong: Delete the connection from the report.
CheckActions.StiDeleteDataRelationActionLong: Delete the relation from the report.
CheckActions.StiDeleteDataSourceActionLong: Delete the Data Source from the report.
CheckActions.StiDeleteLostPointsActionLong: Delete all lost points on a page
CheckActions.StiDeletePageActionLong: Delete the page from the report.
CheckActions.StiFixCrossLinePrimitiveActionLong: Create new points instead of the lost ones. This operation does not guarantee the 100% correct fix!
CheckActions.StiGenerateNewNameComponentActionLong: Generate a new name for the component.
CheckActions.StiGenerateNewNameDataSourceActionLong: Generate a new name for the Data Source.
CheckActions.StiGenerateNewNamePageActionLong: Generate a new name for the page.
CheckActions.StiGenerateNewNameRelationActionLong: Generate a new name for the relation.
CheckActions.StiGenerateNewNameVariableActionLong: Generate a new name for the variable.
CheckActions.StiGrowToHeightOverlappingLong: Set the value of the GrowToHeight property of the component to false.
CheckActions.StiInsufficientTextHeightForOneLineLong: The height of the component will increase at least to the height of one line of text or to the next cell of the report grid.
CheckActions.StiLargeHeightAtPageActionLong: For handy viewing and editing components, the LargeHeight property of the page will be set to true.
CheckActions.StiMinRowsInColumnsActionLong: Set the MinRowsInColumns property to zero.
CheckActions.StiMoveComponentToPageAreaActionLong: The component will be placed so that it is entirely placed on the page. In this case the page fields are not taken into consideration.
CheckActions.StiMoveComponentToPrintablePageAreaActio: Move the component to the page printing area. Page margins will be taken into consideration.
CheckActions.StiNegativeSizesOfComponentsActionLong: Fix the size of the component to eliminate problems when rendering a report. This operation does not guarantee the 100% correct fix!
CheckActions.StiOrientationPageToLandscapeActionLong: Switch the page to the landscape. Page size will not be changed.
CheckActions.StiOrientationPageToPortraitActionLong: Change the page layout to portrait. Page size will not be changed.
CheckActions.StiPrintHeadersFootersFromPreviousPageLo: Set the PrintHeadersFootersFromPreviousPage property of a page to false.
CheckActions.StiPrintOnPreviousPageLong: Set the PrintOnPreviousPage property of a page to false.
CheckActions.StiPropertiesOnlyEngineV1ActionLong: Disable properties of the '{0}' component which are not supported in the EngineV2.
CheckActions.StiPropertiesOnlyEngineV2ActionLong: Disable properties of the component which are not supported in the EngineV1.
CheckActions.StiResetPageNumberActionLong: Set the ResetPageNumber property of a page to false.
CheckActions.StiSwitchToParametersVerticalOrientation: Switch the value of the 'Parameters Orientation' report property to 'Vertical'.
CheckActions.StiSwitchWidthAndHeightOfPageActionLong: Rearrange the height and width of the page.
CheckActions.StiVerySmallSizesOfComponentsLong: The size of a component will be increased to the GridSize value of a report. This operation does not guarantee the 100% correct fix!
CheckActions.StiWordWrapCanGrowTextDoesNotFitActionLo: Set the value of the CanGrow property of the component to true.

Publish.ChangeExportSettingsToolTip: The code for creating the settings class of the selected export format will be added. In the project, you can change the export settings.
Publish.ConnectionsFromReportToolTip: Connections saved in the report template will be used without any modifications.
Publish.ConnectionsRegDataToolTip: You will be offered to connect data from code in the form of XML or JSON data, or, if possible, in the form of business objects.
Publish.ConnectionsReplaceToolTip: You will be offered to change the connection from the code, depending on its type - file path, database connection string.
Publish.EmbedAllDataToResources: The report contains data connections that are not supported in the selected platform. Do you want to embed available data in the report as resources? In this case, all connections will be replaced with XML resources.
Publish.EmbedAllDataToResourcesToolTip: All data will be loaded and added to the report template as resources. This allows you to view the report without having to query the database.
Publish.FullScreenViewer: Display the Viewer in Full Browser Window
Publish.FullScreenViewerToolTip: The viewer with the report will be displayed in the entire available space of the browser window.
Publish.GetLibrariesFromToolTip: All necessary libraries and scripts will be connected from the repository. Otherwise, they will be copied into the project and connected directly.
Publish.IncludeFontsToolTip: The fonts necessary for correct calculation of the sizes of report components will be copied and connected to the project.
Publish.IncludeFormPackedStringToCode: Include Form as Packed String to Code
Publish.IncludeFormPackedStringToCodeToolTip: The form will be saved as a Base64 string right in the project code. This allows you to get rid of additional files.
Publish.IncludeLibrariesToStandalone: Include Stimulsoft Libraries to the Executable File
Publish.IncludeLibrariesToStandaloneToolTip: All necessary libraries and files will be included in the executable file. Otherwise, a ZIP archive will be created.
Publish.IncludeLicenseKeyToolTip: The license key from the account of the currently authorized user will be integrated into the project.
Publish.IncludeLocalizationToolTip: The selected localization will be copied and connected to the project.
Publish.IncludeReportPackedStringToCode: Include Report as Packed String to Code
Publish.IncludeReportPackedStringToCodeToolTip: The report will be saved as a Base64 string right in the project code. This allows you to get rid of additional files.
Publish.IncludeUIThemeToolTip: The selected user interface theme will be set in the component settings.
Publish.LoadReportOnServerSide: Load the Report on the Server Side
Publish.LoadReportOnServerSideToolTip: The report file will be loaded on the server side and transferred to the component as a Base64 string. This avoids unnecessary requests to the server.
Publish.ParametersFromReportToolTip: The values of the parameters set in the report template will be used.
Publish.ParametersReplacePhpInfo: The parameter will be removed from the report dictionary and can be used only in the SQL query.
Publish.ParametersReplaceToolTip: You will be offered to change the values of the report parameters from the code.
Publish.ParametersRequestFromUserToolTip: The report parameter will be requested from the user when viewing the report in the viewer window.
Publish.PublishTypeProjectToolTip: A ZIP archive will be created with the finished project and all the necessary files for further compilation and launch.
Publish.PublishTypeStandaloneToolTip: An already compiled application for viewing the report will be created.
Publish.RegDataOnlyForPreviewToolTip: The data will be connected to the report only at the moment of the preview.
Publish.RegDataSynchronizeToolTip: After connecting the data to the report, the data dictionary will be synchronized - data sources, columns and their types, data links.
Publish.ReportErrors: Unfortunately, due to errors, this report cannot be published!
Publish.SaveExportedPagesToArchive: Save all pages in one ZIP archive
Publish.SaveExportedPagesToArchiveToolTip: Each report page will be exported to the selected image format, all pages will be added into one ZIP archive.
Publish.SaveExportedReportToFile: Save the exported report to a file
Publish.SaveExportedReportToFileToolTip: Saving the exported report on the server side to the specified file. The export function will return a boolean result.
Publish.ServerSideReportProcessingToolTip: Loading, building and exporting the report will be done on the server-side using the Node.js platform.
Publish.TrialVersionHasExpired: Trial Version. Your subscription has expired and requires renewal.
Publish.TrialVersionNotIncluded: Trial Version. This product is not included in your subscription.
Publish.UseCompilationCacheToolTip: The rendered report will be saved in a temporary directory, which allows you to speed up its rendering and reduce memory usage.
Publish.UseCompressedScriptsToolTip: Packed scripts will be used instead of regular ones. This allows you to reduce their size, but it takes some time to unpack when running.
Publish.UseHtmlTemplateToolTip: Use an HTML template to display the component. This allows you to place other elements on the page, and use JavaScript events.
Publish.UseLatestVersion: Use the latest version of libraries
Publish.UseLatestVersionToolTip: When connecting libraries and scripts, the latest available official version of the product will be used instead of the currently installed version.
Publish.UseRenderedReportToolTip: The report will be built and saved in document format. You will no longer need a data connection to view the report, but any interactivity and report parameters will not be available.
Publish.UseWpfDesignerV2ToolTip: The updated WPF report designer will be used. It has a new UI, increased speed, and other optimizations.

The value should be set in the range from 0 to 100. If the value is 100 then, in any case, a new page will be formed. This property is used together with the StartNewPage property.

For using this property it is necessary to enable the CanBreak property of the band on which the cross-tab is placed (if it is placed on the band).

StiDynamicBand.BreakIfLessThan: A value that indicates how much free space is on a page (in per cent) should be reserved for formation of a new page or a new column. The value should be set in the range from 0 to 100. If the value is 100 then, in any case, a new page or a new column will be formed. This property is used together with NewPageBefore, NewPageAfter, NewColumnBefore, NewColumnAfter properties.
StiDynamicBand.NewColumnAfter: If the value of this property is true, then, after output of a band, a new column will be generated.
StiDynamicBand.NewColumnBefore: If the value of this property is true, then, before output of a band, a new column will be generated.
StiDynamicBand.NewPageAfter: If the value of this property is true, then, after output of a band, a new page will be generated.
StiDynamicBand.NewPageBefore: If the value of this property is true, then, before output of a band, a new page will be generated. Output of a band will be continued on the next page.
StiDynamicBand.PrintAtBottom: A value indicates that the footer is printed at bottom of page.
StiDynamicBand.SkipFirst: If the value of this property is true, then, a new page/column will be generated only starting from the second case.

StiPage.PageWidth: The total width of the page.

StiPage.UnlimitedHeight: A value indicates that the page has an unlimited height.
StiPage.UnlimitedWidth: A value indicates that the page has an unlimited width.

StiTableStyle.FooterColor: The property defines the color which will be used to fill the background of the footer row.
StiTableStyle.FooterForeground: The property defines the color which will be used for drawing the values in the footer row.
StiTableStyle.GridColor: The property defines the color which will be used for drawing the cell borders.
StiTableStyle.HeaderColor: The property defines the color which will be used to fill the background of the header row.
StiTableStyle.HeaderForeground: The property defines the color which will be used for drawing the values in the header row.
StiTableStyle.HotHeaderColor: The property defines the color which will be used to fill the background of the header row when the cursor is hovered on it.
StiTableStyle.SelectedDataColor: The property defines the color which will be used to fill the background of the selected cell.
StiTableStyle.SelectedDataForeground: The property defines the color which will be used for drawing the value in the selected cell.

StiText.AllowHtmlTags: A value indicates that this component allows HTML tags in a text.
StiText.Angle: An angle of a text rotation.
StiText.AutoWidth: A value indicates that this object can change width automatically.
StiText.ExcelValue: An expression that is used to export data to Excel. Only for numeric values.
StiText.ExportAsImage: A value that indicates how content of a text will be exported as an image or as a text.
StiText.GetExcelValueEvent: Occurs when the ExcelValue is calculated.
StiText.RenderTo: In the property specify the Text component in what the text that is out of the current Text component bound will be continued to be output.
StiText.ShrinkFontToFit: A value indicates that this component decreases font size to fit contents of a component.
StiText.ShrinkFontToFitMinimumSize: A value that indicates minimum font size for ShrinkFontToFit operation.
StiText.TextOptions: Options to control of the text showing.
StiText.TextQuality: A value that indicates text quality.

StiTextBoxControl.AcceptsReturn: A value indicates whether pressing ENTER in a multiline TextBox control creates a new line of text in the control or activates the default button for the form.
StiTextBoxControl.AcceptsTab: A value indicates whether pressing the TAB key in a multiline text box control types a TAB character in the control instead of moving the focus to the next control in the tab order.
StiTextBoxControl.MaxLength: Maximum number of characters the user can type into the text box control.
StiTextBoxControl.Multiline: A value indicates whether this is a multiline text box control.
StiTextBoxControl.PasswordChar: A character used to mask characters of a password in a single-line TextBox control.
StiTextBoxControl.Text: A current text in the text box.
StiTextBoxControl.WordWrap: Indicates whether a multiline text box control automatically wraps words to the beginning of the next line when necessary.

StiTextElement.SizeMode: Specifies how the text output in the component area depends on the text size.

StiTextOptions.Angle: An angle of a text rotation.
StiTextOptions.HotkeyPrefix: A type of drawing hot keys.
StiTextOptions.LineLimit: A value that shows compleleted lines only.
StiTextOptions.Trimming: A type to trim the end of a line.

StiTreeViewControl.AfterSelectEvent: Occurs when the AfterSelect property has changed.

StiTrendLine.LineColor: A color which will be used for drawing trend line.
StiTrendLine.ShowShadow: A value that indicates draw shadow or no.

StiUpcABarCodeType.Height: Gets or sets height factor of the bar code.
StiUpcABarCodeType.Module: Gets or sets width of the most fine element of the bar code.
StiUpcABarCodeType.ShowQuietZoneIndicator: Gets or sets value which indicates will show Quiet Zone Indicator or no.
StiUpcABarCodeType.SupplementCode: Gets or sets the component supplement bar code.
StiUpcABarCodeType.SupplementType: Gets or sets type of supplement code.

StiUpcEBarCodeType.Height: Gets or sets height factor of the bar code.
StiUpcEBarCodeType.Module: Gets or sets width of the most fine element of the bar code.
StiUpcEBarCodeType.SupplementCode: Gets or sets the component supplement bar code.
StiUpcEBarCodeType.SupplementType: Gets or sets type of supplement code.

StiUpcSup2BarCodeType.Height: Gets or sets height factor of the bar code.
StiUpcSup2BarCodeType.Module: Gets or sets width of the most fine element of the bar code.
StiUpcSup2BarCodeType.ShowQuietZoneIndicator: Gets or sets value which indicates will show Quiet Zone Indicator or no.

StiUpcSup5BarCodeType.Height: Gets or sets height factor of the bar code.
StiUpcSup5BarCodeType.Module: Gets or sets width of the most fine element of the bar code.
StiUpcSup5BarCodeType.ShowQuietZoneIndicator: Gets or sets value which indicates will show Quiet Zone Indicator or no.

StiUserFunction.InterpretationModeSwitchToBlocks: This report uses Interpretation mode. Functions with code will not work. We recommend switching to ScriptMode on Blocks.
StiUserFunction.StiScriptAtInterpretationCheckLong: The script in the user function '{0}' doesn't work in the interpretation mode.
StiUserFunction.StiUserFunctionLangScriptValueCheckLong: No script defined for {0} language in the user function '{1}'.
StiUserFunction.StiUserFunctionScriptValueCheckLong: No script specified for the current report programming language in the user function '{0}'.

StiView.AspectRatio: A value indicates that an image will save its aspect ratio.
StiView.MultipleFactor: A value to multiply by it an image size.
StiView.Smoothing: The smoothing mode for drawing an image.
StiView.Stretch: A value indicates that this component will stretch the image till an image will get size equal in its size on a page.

StiWatermark.AspectRatio: A value indicates that this watermark's image will save its aspect ratio.
StiWatermark.Enabled: A value that indicates whether the Watermark should be drawn or not.
StiWatermark.Image: A value of the watermark's image.
StiWatermark.ImageMultipleFactor: A value to multiply by its image size.
StiWatermark.ImageStretch: A value indicates that this watermark's image will be stretched on the page.
StiWatermark.ImageTiling: The watermark's image should be tiled.
StiWatermark.ShowBehind: A value that indicates whether Watermark should be drawn behind or in front of page.
StiWatermark.ShowImageBehind: A value that indicates whether the Watermark image should be drawn behind or in front of a page.
StiWatermark.TextBrush: The brush of the watermark, which is used to display text.

StiWinControl.BackColor: The background color for the control.
StiWinControl.Font: The font of the text displayed by the control.
StiWinControl.ForeColor: The foreground color of the control.
StiWinControl.Text: The text associated with this control.

StiXChartAxis.ShowEdgeValues: A value indicates that first and last arguments on axis will be shown anyway.
StiXChartAxis.StartFromZero: A value indicates that all arguments will be shows from zero.
StiXChartAxis.Title: Axis title settings.

StiXChartAxisTitle.Direction: A text direction for axis title drawing.

StiYChartAxis.StartFromZero: A value indicates that all arguments will be shows from zero.

StiYChartAxisTitle.Direction: A text direction for axis title drawing.

StiZipCode.Code: An expression to fill a code of zip code.
StiZipCode.GetZipCodeEvent: Occurs when getting the code of zip code.
StiZipCode.Ratio: A value that indicates width and height ratio.

Universal.AllowApplyStyle: A value indicates that chart style will be used.
Universal.Key: A Key which will be used in variables when user select associated with it Value in GUI.
Universal.Label: A Label which will be displayed instead of Key in GUI.
Universal.Value: A Value which will be displayed instead of the Key value in GUI.
